result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Z Mohr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: RCJ for contempt for failure to pay by due date.

With Huber for work and school. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.  Expungement granted if probation on Ct. 3 of 15CF924 is successfully completed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler Z Mohr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Tyler Z Mohr in court with attorney Philip Edward Marry.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State had no additions or corrections to PSI.  Victim written statement provided as unable to be present today.
Defense had one correction to PSI regarding correct case number being CM rather than CF.  Has viewed victim statement.  Support letters provided.

State recommends withheld sentence with probation and conditional time.  
Defense requests probation and expungement.

BTC:  on 15CF924 Count 3:  Withheld sentence - Probation 3 years
no alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment and aftercare, and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent
full time employment, employment/school
No further restitution ordered at this time.
No contact with victims unless approved by them and agent.

CIP and SAT eligible
DNA sample
firearms/voting warnings given
Costs including DNA assmt.

on CM474 ct 1, and 924 counts 2 & 5  EACH:
6 months RCJ concurrent to one another.
Huber for work/school.   Report-in  date 11-26-16.
 
also, on ct 1, costs but not DNA surcharge.
on cts 2 & 5 Costs & DNA surcharge

Expungement granted on ALL if probation completed 100% successfullly.
CFTS - only toward revocation, not toward 6 months RCJ.
